[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure Operational Interface (SOI) defines requirements for high availability, security enforcement, coding standards compliance, and version control integration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SOI ensures system uptime, operational reliability, access control, coding standard enforcement, version control, and platform independence.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SOI integrates with authentication, version control, and uptime monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SOI enforces access control, distinguishing trusted and untrusted users.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SOI operates across multiple hardware platforms, ensuring platform independence.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SOI applies standardized coding practices across development environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SOI ensures secure authentication and version control communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SOI optimizes large data processing without performance degradation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SOI handles access control, uptime monitoring, security, and development workflow tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SOI supports multi-platform operation for system flexibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SOI connects to authentication, system monitoring, and version control services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SOI ensures operational uptime, security, access control, coding standard enforcement, version control, and cross-platform compatibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SOI is designed for system administrators, developers, and users with controlled access levels.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SOI requires network connectivity for version control and security management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SOI relies on secure authentication, coding standard compliance, and robust version control integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: MTBF: Mean time between system failures.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with version control systems for secure source code management.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall enforce authentication before granting access to restricted sections.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enforce access control, limiting access to trusted users (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall apply coding standards across all development environments (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide clear role-based access control for trusted and untrusted users (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall maintain operational availability of highly reliable.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall achieve an MTBF of at least 7 days.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store access logs, version history, and security settings (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to predefined coding standards for all supported programming languages.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow best practices for authentication, access control, and source code versioning (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure platform independence across supported hardware (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: System availability, security enforcement, coding standard adherence, and platform compatibility validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Development documentation, coding standard policies, version control guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: System uptime monitoring protocols, access control policies, secure coding best practices.
